title: Ninety Six National Historic Site: Reptiles
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Reptiles                Reptiles         Black Racer (Coluber constrictor). J.D. Willson, Savannah River Ecology Laboratory.  Ninety Six supports a modest number of habitats for reptiles and amphibians in the bottomland hardwood habitats, shallow wetlands, stream, and floodplain areas. The park's herpetofaunal inventory includes several species of frogs, salamanders, turtles, lizards, and snakes. Of 87 species within range, 31 were documented in the park during a study conducted between 2002 and 2005.  (Reed & Gibbons, Southern Utah University, 2005).
